snippet: At least 20 have been killed in recent weeks in the tumult over President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to seek another term, and more than 50,000 people have fled to neighboring countries.
abstract: Violent demonstrations have continued to escalate across Burundi in month since decision by Pres Pierre Nkurunziza to seek another term, and more than 50,000 have fled to bordering nations; announcement from Burundian military that Nkurunziza has been removed from power in coup has entire nation fearing start of another long period of deadly unrest.
lead_paragraph: At least 20 have been killed in recent weeks in the tumult over President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to seek another term, and more than 50,000 people have fled to neighboring countries.

headline.main: Political Turmoil Returns to Burundi as President Seeks New Term
headline.print_headline: After Years of Peace, Burundians Fear a Slide Back Into Chaos

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
